Description: Shoulder fragment of North Ionian pottery closed vase, perhaps an oinochoe. Inside reserved; exterior: tongues above dilute line at top of shoulder; volute and floral pattern in frieze below, with probable handle zone to left; various filling ornament; band below.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the National Museum of Scotland. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.617)
CVA Edinburgh / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum National Museums of Scotland Edinburgh (p.4 and pl.3, 19)
